Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang of the Great Tang Dynasty, on Imperial Order
Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in the TathÄgata's realm, in the jeweled assembly ground of the buddhas,
the capital of all buddhas, the delight of all buddhas,
the wondrous palace of the bodhisattvas, free from doubts and hindrances,
the great hall of merit, adorned with various subtle adornments, always expounding the Dharma.
He was together with innumerable great bodhisattvas,
all of whom were the TathÄgata's Dharma heirs,
having come to assemble from the buddha-lands.
Immeasurable devas, humans, asuras, and others,
the great assembly of arhats, surrounded him in front and back.
At that time the World-Honored One said to the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas,
Good sons, there is a dhÄraá¹‡Ä« called the Buddhas' Mind,
recited by buddhas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.
It can universally benefit those who are afraid.
If there are those who sincerely accept, uphold, recite, and chant it,
they will transcend the suffering of birth and death for a hundred thousand kalpas.
will definitely attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
They will be able to quickly practice and never regress.
They will never be born in vain in worlds without Buddhas.
They will always understand all dharanis well.
They will always see the Tathagata, be close to him, and make offerings to him.
They will always remember their past lives and deeply believe in cause and effect.
They will be able to eliminate all enmity and harm from humans and non-humans in the present world.
Diseases will not invade them and they will not die prematurely.
All evil demonic affairs will be completely destroyed.
All evil karma will be eliminated without exception.
All demonic armies will be terrified and scatter.
Good sons, the words and phrases of this dharani
are praised by all Buddhas together.
They are the words and phrases of all Buddhas.
You should listen attentively to the dharani, which goes:
Buddha tiğŸ”½Su buddha tiğŸ”½Moha buddha ti
I ti buddha tiğŸ”½Dada la buddha ti
Buddha buddha buddha buddha buddha buddha buddha buddha buddha buddha
Svaha After the Buddha spoke this great authoritative Dharani of all Buddhas,
At that time, the great earth and great ocean of the trichiliocosm,
And the king of the great snow mountains all shook at the same time in eighteen ways.
The heavenly palaces all tilted and swayed.
The fierce and rebellious demon army lost their majestic light.
They looked at each other in fear, trembling and worried.
At that time, those who were to be liberated in the trichiliocosm,
Startled by this sign, all cried out three times.
Only the heavenly beings who had faith in the Three Jewels,
Each held heavenly flowers and scattered them from afar over the Buddha.
And exhorting the various demons to take refuge in the Buddha's teachings.
At that time the World-Honored One said to the bodhisattvas:
I now, out of compassion for all sentient beings, will speak a dhÄraá¹‡Ä« to enable them to escape from suffering and difficulty.
You should properly remember and spread it in the world.
Cause all to uphold it and attain victorious benefits and happiness.
At that time the bodhisattvas and the rest of the assembly
All greatly rejoiced, believed, accepted, and practiced it.
